intro: Leucas abyssinica var. sidamoensis, commonly known as the Sidamo leucas, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in umbels, adding ornamental value to the plant. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
